page.title: 05Bonneyhale Mushroom Farm
page.content: The compost is ruffled through a machine.The spawn is then added.The spawn is mycelia.It is so small,like very fine dust or powder which is specially prepared in labortories.It is put onto grains of wheat or millet, or onto a kind of stick.These are inserted into the compost and the mycelia spreads out.The room is kept at 25 degrees C for 10 days.The compost must be kept moist.The palettes are then taken from the spawn running room to the preparation room. Here there is a machine which mixes a covering called a casing.It is a mixture of 50.8kg of peat and 50kg.of chalk.The chalk makes the mixture alkaline.The casing mixture is then saturated with water and spread into the compost about 3.8 cm deep .The palettes are then transferred to the growing room.There are 7 growing sheds
